per_player.Alice: Played too passively. Failed to capitalize on being saved by witch. Improvement: Claim your saved status earlier to gain credibility.
per_player.Bob: Good wolf play. Created early misdirection and blended well. Improvement: Avoid being first to name specific players.
per_player.Charlie: Reasonable villager logic but lacked impact. Improvement: Build stronger voting alliances with confirmed goods.
per_player.David: Hunter was too quiet. Never used threat effectively. Improvement: Announce your role to deter wolves from targeting you.
per_player.Eve: Guardian protected wolves twice. Poor protection choices. Improvement: Protect suspected power roles, not quiet players.
per_player.Frank: Villager eliminated D1. Wrongly suspected Alice. Improvement: Don't make strong accusations without evidence.
per_player.Grace: Good witch play saving Alice. Held poison too long. Improvement: Use poison earlier on strong wolf suspects.
per_player.Henry: Solid wolf teamwork. Supported pack without drawing attention. Improvement: Coordinate voting patterns more naturally.
per_player.Ivy: Seer found wolf Kate but revealed too late. Improvement: Share findings immediately after confirming wolf.
per_player.Jack: Villager with good meta-analysis but seen as suspicious. Improvement: Frame consensus arguments more carefully.
per_player.Kate: Wolf survived seer check by staying quiet. Good deception. Improvement: Be more active in discussions to blend.
per_player.Leo: Excellent wolf play creating division. Mastered framing arguments. Improvement: Maintain consistent voting patterns.

overall: Werewolves won through coordinated voting and creating villager infighting. They manipulated day 1 vote onto Frank, then maintained control by dividing villagers with meta-arguments about consensus. The seer discovered a wolf but revealed too late, and guardian protected wolves twice.

Villager: Question early pushes against specific players without evidence
Coordinate voting with confirmed good players when possible
Watch for wolves framing village consensus as suspicious
Pressure quiet players who avoid engagement and discussion
Build alliances with power roles early to establish trust
Analyze voting patterns rather than blindly following consensus
Werewolf: Create early misdirection on day one to sow confusion
Blend voting patterns with village majority when safe
Frame villager coordination as evidence of wolfpack behavior
Support pack members subtly through strategic voting patterns
Target power roles consistently during night kill phases
Use meta-arguments about gameplay to create division
Seer: Share wolf findings immediately after confirming their identity
Check quiet players avoiding discussion for wolf potential
Verify players pushing strong narratives without evidence
Coordinate findings with witch and guardian when confirmed
Don't reveal role until necessary for village benefit
Track voting patterns of checked players for consistency
Witch: Save confirmed good players immediately with healing potion
Use poison on strong wolf suspects early in game
Coordinate potion usage with seer findings when possible
Don't hold potions too long as value decreases
Claim saved players to confirm their alignment publicly
Watch for wolves avoiding night targets to identify pack
Guardian: Protect suspected power roles first before others
Avoid protecting quiet or inactive players as targets
Coordinate protection timing with witch save availability
Never protect same player consecutively to avoid patterns
Watch for wolves suggesting protection targets carefully
Protect yourself when no clear targets are available
Hunter: Announce role early to deter wolves from targeting
Vote carefully as death reveals your final vote
Coordinate with confirmed good players before major votes
Use death threat to control voting and wolf behavior
Avoid random accusations that could mislead village
Protect power roles through strategic vote influence
